channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pharma giant Merck expects Trump’s tariffs to cost the company $200 million
item.description: The news comes a week after J&J executives said they expect $400 million in tariff-induced expenses in 2025.

item.title: Investment bankers have ‘work-from-beach’ dreams crushed after Citi shutters its Málaga office
item.description: Economic headwinds may force junior employees to prioritize job security over work-life balance.

item.title: There are 2 types of managers suffering the most right now and it could spell disaster for the workplace
item.description: "Managers are handed an almost impossible task of making it all work in the real world."

item.title: Markets notch small gains as tech stocks rise and Trump delivers mixed signals on tariffs
item.description: President Donald Trump said he’s made “200 deals” on tariffs but declined to say with whom.

item.title: Elon Musk defends political deepfakes on X in latest free speech battle
item.description: X is challenging the constitutionality of a Minnesota ban on using deepfakes to influence elections and harm candidates.

item.title: Stock-market bulls are cheering a rare technical signal. Here’s how it works.
Where Trump’s tariffs and economic promises stand as he nears 100 days in office
U.S. stocks end higher with Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq all scoring weekly gains
A ‘property-tax revolt’ is underway across the U.S. Here’s what’s driving it.
Kevin Warsh says the Fed is broken. He’s taking dead aim at Powell’s job.
